title: 104_hr308
content: The "Hopewell Township Investment Act of 1995" is also known as the Act. It involves the conveyance of land. The "Hopewell Township Investment Act of 1995" authorizes the Administrator of General Services to convey land in Hopewell Township, Pennsylvania to the Beaver County Corporation for Economic Development for economic development purposes. The land is described in detail in the Act. Pennsylvania Legislative Route No. 60 is described by specific courses and distances, including points and cul-de-sac on Industrial Drive. The route follows curves with defined radii for certain arc distances. The Pennsylvania Legislative Route No. 60 follows specific courses and distances, including curves with defined radii for arc distances. The route includes points and cul-de-sac on Industrial Drive, with various directional changes and curve radii specified. The Pennsylvania Legislative Route No. 60 follows specific courses and distances, including curves with defined radii for arc distances. The route includes points and cul-de-sac on Industrial Drive, with various directional changes and curve radii specified. Thence by a curve to the right, having a radius of 320.00 feet for an arc distance of 256.85 feet to a point, and by a curve to the right having a radius of 50.00 feet for an arc distance of 44.18 feet to a point on the northerly side of Airport Road. The conveyance of property required under subsection (a) must be completed within 90 days of the enactment of this Act. The terms and conditions for the conveyance will be determined by the Administrator to protect the interests of the United States, and it will be done through a quitclaim deed. SEC. 3. LIMITATION ON CONVEYANCE. No land conveyed under section 2 can be used for any purpose other than economic development for 30 years. SEC. 4. REVERSIONARY INTEREST. The property will revert to the United States if used for a purpose other than economic development within the 30-year period. The Administrator will enforce the reversion, and the property will be under the control of the General Services Administration.
